intro: Apowollastonia spilanthoides, commonly known as the spilanthoides hakea, is a shrub native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, wiry foliage and small, pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions. It produces woody capsules that contain numerous small, hard seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
